ratings.question_text: How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: Great notes and explanations. Very logical class and friendly. It kept me motivated all semester. Books were not that useful though.

I thought the pace was a little fast, but instead of eliminating topics, I think I could do without as much mathematical background. I'm not as concerned about knowing what the computer is doing beyond what is necessary to explain differences in results.
Please take the intro class before taking this class or be very meticulous about brushing up with foundations on stat.

6) I would like to highly recommend that consideration be given to offering this class in 50 minute sessions that occur three times per week instead of two longer classes. I think you'd find better retention of information by students and a higher energy and engagement level. The information is dense and it's hard to stay as focused as you need and want to be for the full hour and twenty minutes.
JDRS is a great teacher. He makes difficult material accessible and fun to learn, and he is very giving of his time.

The instructor, its clarity and contagious enthusiasm. The material covered is very helpful for research and provides a good base for stats. Powerpoint slides were simple and logical. The final Jeopardy was a wonderful interactive idea as a review.
the large number of methods covered
The professor is great!
The methods taught in the class are difficult, but the teacher made them so easy to use.
The instructor is funny~!
Very useful in other courses
The instructor was one of the best teachers I've had as an undergrad and a grad student. Was definitely the best statistics teacher I've ever had.

JDRS's teaching style is extremely conducive to learning difficult conceptual material. He repeats concepts and asks for answers from the class which generates an engagement that fosters a greater understanding of the topics.
Jonathan sets aside a lot of time for students

Jonathan is an amazing teacher of the material. I had no experience in multivariate statistics and I learned so much and feel I have a working knowledge of statistical methods and how and when to employ them.

This class helped me to analysis the data I gathered for my degree research, which was critical and something I couldn't get from my advisor. It also provided me with the ability to better critique statistical methods used in the primary literature.The TA for this course was very patient and available. I utilized her help on almost all problem sets and she helped me to truly learn the material. Without her I wouldn't have learned half as much from the homeworkassignments.Getting to learn R (seriously) and getting to use my own data in the context of a class.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: Opportunity to program a little would make it a little challenging. It is great that the codes are all given. Maybe create a little algorithm in R or something. Also some improvement on granola bar throwing skills.
pace
There are in total 6 lab hours. However, for some of us, we may need more lab hours.

This course would ideally be taught in the lab with a step by step "here's how you use this software" with a sample dataset. Then when we do homework, we can choose to use our own dataset, or a new dataset. I feel like there was too much theory and not enough application on "here's how you use SPSS and here's what you have to do when you get inside the program..." etc. That would really TREMENDOUSLY help increase the value of this course!
There should be more required lab sessions. Otherwise it's really hard to learn how to use all the 3 softwares involved in this class.
Nothing, it is a great class. Could perhaps do with a bit more structure towards the end of the semester because we finished the lecture material early.
Not applicable.
Notes and homeworks could be clearer and more consistent
The pace can be quick because there's a lot of material to work through.

I would have appreciated feedback about the dataset that I provided at the beginning of the semester and intended to use for the problem sets. It would have been very helpful to know up front what methods/problem sets I likely wouldn't be able to use my data for. Instead, I didn't receive any feedback on what I submitted.It would be TREMENDOUSLY helpful for different versions of the course notes to be provided depending on which software package you are using. I think the creation of these different set of notes would help insure that examples for each software package are available for each method (with obvious gaps where particular software packages are inadequate).I cannot stress strongly enough how much the professor lost my respect by repeatedly either canceling lab hours at the last minute or showing up over one hour late. In addition, there were repeated instances where the professor did not show up for office hours--in spite of there being people signed up for every available office hour slot. In the case of lab hours showing up late meant that he had to quickly dash around the room to help everyone who had anxiously been waiting. This made his demeanor curt and dismissive and generally unpleasant to interact with. I was extremely disappointed in the lack of reliability and availability that this caused. Thank goodness for the TA!

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: The open sessions that JDRS holds in the stat lab are incredibly useful.
TA and instructors were both helpful, prompt to answer questions and available. The quality of help was great.
Good. I was glad Jonathan held more office hours at the end of the year.
They are great. Very helpful.
quick response and very helpful
The instructor is really nice
Always responsive by email, took the time during office hours to discuss questions with me until I felt like I understood the answers
Fantastic available and quality of help from both the instructor and the TA.
Excellent availability
They were both very helpful.
Ashley held regular office hours as did JDRS. Both were extremely responsive and willing to help.
See answers to questions 12 and 13.Professor reliability was a serious issue outside of class.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: This course was so valuable. Already I can understand methods in journal papers that I would have had no idea what they were talking about before.

I audited this class to learn about multivariate stats, because I do a lot of genomics with big datasets. PCA, cluster analysis and canonical correlation are all great downstream analyses to complement a study or a paper.
a computation skill to take to research and interpretation of scientific data/ results
Everyone needs to know how to do stats if they are interested in analyzing their research (data).
For my future research I need statistics to analyze my data
This course is very helpful in a number of other courses, almost all courses that deal with a great number of data.

I am working in the field of natural resource economics next year and will most certainly use practical applications of multivariate statistics. Knowing the SPSS software was also a very helpful skill to present to potential employers during job interviews.
As an MESc student, this course was great in working through my data.
I intend to pursue a research career after FES and knowledge of when and how to use these statistical methods is important.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I was interested in the material.
To learn about downstream statistical analyses to handle multivariate, large-scale data from functional genomics experiments.
because I want more specific skills to take into the field
I need some stat techniques
To learn some more sophisticated statistics.
To see my research data in a new way.
I think it is useful for my research.
Useful
I wanted to take advanced statistics and to learn techniques that might be useful for my thesis work.
In order to better understand statistics and be able to apply the theories to practical applications.
To get a good working knowledge of multivariate statistics and to be able to apply it to my data.

In order to analyze the data I collected over the summer between my first and second years at FES. Would have liked to take this class in the fall when the data was still freshest in my memory. Maybe the class could be offered in the fall instead?

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: It's so rewarding to work with your own dataset all semester.
Yes, it was plain awesome.
yes
Actually not, because I want more maths, but not how to use the stat software
More or less.
Definitly
Sort of
Not really, because I don't have enough time to learn all the softwares.
Yes.
Yes.
Yes
Yes!
Essentially, although I left the course disappointed with the professor which I certainly didn't expect going in (had a much more positive experience in the Intro to Statistics course).

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Yes, it's a great course.
More than expected, I had an awesome time learning and practicing several analyses.
partially. I want more maths.
Not quite, see above.
Yes.
Yes, I think so
Absolutely. Exceeded my expectations
Yes.
Yes
Definitely.
Many of the methods taught in the class ended up not being suitable for my data, which was unfortunate, but I did get through the MANOVA analysis I hoped to accomplish.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Learn from each other is a great experience. However, shirking problem may also arise.
It's helpful that each of us are spending less time on the assignment and the disucssion are very helpful, but at the same time, each of us learnt to use only software but not all of them.

Advantage - I was able to use a very interesting dataset compiled by a classmate to learn more about a subject that complemented my own research quite nicelyDisadvantage - One of the group members did very little work, leaving most of the assignments to be completed by the others
Definitely helped to talk through concepts. We each picked up different things from the course, so coming together really helped.
Really helpful to discuss with other people.
Group was difficult at times because there was not individual evaluation through out the semester, except for class participation.
It's very interesting to work with others and learn from each other. But some times it's hard to split work.

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Multivariate data are everywhere these days and this class teaches you principles of these analyses as well as their application. The instructor conveys his message effectively, with great passion and peoples' skills.
keep up with the material and constantly review topics covered previously
Do the homeworks early. They are not as easy as they look.
It's worthwhile to take.
Do all of the assignments when they are assigned.
Go to class

Be prepared to work hard, and make sure you keep up with lectures and assignments. As the pace moves quickly, it's important to stay on top of things. Also, take advantage of Jonathan's office hours to go over questions and any other statistic-related questions you might have.

Use the TA's lab hours to get help. Work in a group if you feel comfortable sharing your data with others. Meet with JDRS at the beginning of the semester to discuss which methods you likely will and will not be able to use for your data.
really prepare for the lecture by rehearsing last week, otherwise you are lost
